p.#text:
A1C is a blood test forand. It
      measures your average blood glucose, or, level over the past 3 months. Doctors may use the A1C alone or in combination with
      other diabetes tests to make a diagnosis. They also use the A1C to see how well you are
      managing your diabetes. This test is different from the blood sugar checks that people with
      diabetes do every day.

p:
Your A1C test result is given in percentages. The higher the
      percentage, the higher your blood sugar levels have been:
NIH: National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases

li: A normal A1C level is below 5.7%

Prediabetes is between 5.7 to 6.4%. Having prediabetes is a risk factor for getting type
      2 diabetes. People with prediabetes may need retests every year.

If you have diabetes, you should have the A1C test at least twice a year. The A1C goal
      for many people with diabetes is below 7. It may be different for you. Ask what your goal
      should be. If your A1C result is too high, you may need to change your diabetes care plan.

health-topic.primary-institute:
National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive
      and Kidney Diseases
